Name: Caf√© Belgique

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text:
There was so beautiful bar and good music.
I enjoyed the place : )
If you like jazz You must go there.

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text: Between so many bars in Amsterdam I found Cafe Belgique to be with unique character and fabulous atmosphere. So well decorated and lovely it could be only love at the first sight. Staff is just great, friendly and spontaneous. I'll be back next time. It is such a wonderful place to be.

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text: Belgiums spirit. Like the vibe and there are amazing beers! Service also friendly.

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text: Great place to be.! Class act all around from the staff to the locals who hang out there

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text: Definitely one of the coolest Amsterdam bars I've found. Strong glass game: for every beer I've bought here they have the correct glass, and usually with the correct brewery on it. Great vibe and cool bartenders.

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text: One of my fav bars in the center of  Amsterdam near Dam square. Great music, decent beer selection, good crowd usually. Really pleasant service :)

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text: Small, characterful, bohemian cafe bar in the middle of Amsterdam in an alley, with a laid back chilled out vibe and clientele. Smoking allowed outside. Decent beers on tap such as Chimey and La Chouffe.

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text: Great cozy spot to grab a drink with Awesome music. Thanks for a great night Mika, Anton and Marco!  check out - Bassculture.nl

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text: Great beer and friendly staff. Extremely cosy but customers are nice and happy to make room/cuddle! Really lovely atmosphere but very small!

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text: Amazing hole in the wall bar with the greatest selection of Belgian Ales.

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text: Super friendly owner who served us nice beers. I am from Belgium myself and they really succeeded in recreating the belgian atmosphere. Drank some nice draught beers from belgium and had a great talk with the owner.

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text: I always come back here for the best beers and good atmosphere!

Review Text: Best local bar, old but gold 👑

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text: amazing place to get Belgian beer and enjoy lovely music .. also rally cozy and lovely music

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text: Charming old bar. Great beer selection with low prices. People are able to congregate outside and drink, very cool vibe. Small inside for sure but very friendly staff and a great bar nonetheless.

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text: Small, but extremely cozy brown bar in the city center! I really appreciated the wide selection of beers and the courtesy of the staff (something that you don't find so often these days). Apart from the beers they also have a very good …

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text: Tiny little bar. Great range of Belgian beers. Gets very busy!

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text: Great little bar with a huge variety of beers! We’ll definitely be back!

Name: Caf√© Belgique

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text: Great café.. We enjoyed the service good music and very good beers! It's always nice to visit this bar and easy to reach. Amazing interiors with creative walls, quirky staff and a great atmosphere. Make the most of your visit by piping in early, it fills up quickly and the nightly DJs often bring in the crowds.

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text: An amazing traditional bar offering more that 50 varieties of Belgium beers. Stunning interiors with creative walls, quirky staff and a great atmosphere. Make the most of your visit by piping in early, it fills up quickly and the nightly DJs often bring in the crowds, there is limited outdoor seating also.

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text: Great music, there was a DJ that not only played good music, he was also having a great time. Loved the Deco. Great place

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text: Very unique spot! Feels Divey (in a good way) with great beer options!

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text: Excellent small traditional Dutch brown cafe. Serves a variety of Belgian beers. Cosy setting in a side street of the busy centre of Amsterdam. Outside sitting. Very friendly bar staff. Toilet is up a steep stairway so difficult for the disabled.

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text: Really cool place were to drink a good beer in very friendly environment!

Review Text:

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text: Classic dive bar, in the good sense, with a nice selection of beers. Mostly specials. Seating is cramped. It's a small bar but it's open until 0300. Most others are only open until 0200. …

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text: Awesome little cafe right in the heart of Amsterdam. Many many good beers to try, as the name suggest, Belgium ones. The place is also great musically, always bringing nice DJs to set.

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text: Very small pub but worth the visit!

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text: Little, cozy, great offer on Belgium beers, sometimes with a DJ playing some records inside, this bar is a prime jewel in Amsterdam city center. I love to  catch a beer here and listen to some tunes. Always good after work or as a night starter.

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text:
Just super!

Great atmosphere, great small and cozy place, kind and sociable waitresses. …

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text: We came here quite frequently as we love Belgian beers and there's a large selection. It's a great place to stop for a break from shopping as it's in that location. The staff are friendly and it's a relaxed place to sit but we only visited during the day.

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text: Enjoyable small pub, felt like a nice escape from all of the tourist pubs. Felt like I got a real flavour of the pubs/bars of Holland.  Sold a great selection of Belgian ales. A personal favourite was Kwak.

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text: Tiny space, amazing beer selection! Belgian beer is a must and if you're visiting Amsterdam, come to this cozy, warm bar. This was my friends and my favorite spot for excellent beer in Amsterdam.

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text: Small but great beer is served here. The DJ gets you into a nice vibe while you try to get a glimpse of the walls' decor. Tip: I saw many try going upstairs to find a seat; don't bother... there's only a bathroom up there.

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text: Small place, good for a quick beer. Can get really crowded though!

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text: Cozy and small, awesome Belgian beers and great service.

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text: Great little cafe. The beer is delicious and not too expensive. It can feel a little crammed as it is a small place. The staff were nice and friendly. The overall vibe in there was chic and relaxing. I will be back.

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text: Really enjoyed this spot was suprisingly quiet for being a side street off damrak (one of main street of Amsterdam toward dam sqaure) and not too expensive for a good pint, staff were great and helpful, appeared to be plenty of good …

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text: Met  with  a  couple  of  old   Acquaintances  in  this  hidden  gem  recently.  Located  on  Gravenstraat   just  off  the  beaten  path. Great  selection  of  premium  Belgian  beers. Very  cosy  and  intimate  atmosphere.  Also, very  friendly  staff  and  clientele.  Gezellig!

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text: Really nice place. Small but cozy. A large variety of beers to choose from.When I will go back to Amsterdam, I will definitely will go back there

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text: Small dark bar in an alley near the Nieuwe Kerk.   Outstanding beer selection.  Very high turnover on the beer so it's always fresh.  Definitely worth a visit just to see where it is and also taste the Kwak beer.

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text: the best "hidden" places of the city. only 2 tables inside, 2 benches outside. but a wide range of belgian biers on tap, nice crowd, and Maaike is the best bartender :)

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text: A bit strange place. Local and tourists mixing. Can find really good classic Dutch and Belgian beers - not much of the "new craft". A tiny space that probably could be very cozy - but we must have been unlucky and drop during a spell of rather peculiar and uninviting atmosphere.

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text: Horrible cheap dive for punks and addicts. I would have never set my foot there if that were not for a local guide who wanted me to see it. I guess he wanted to impress me in his special kind of way. It is literally vomitrocious.

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text: This bar is one of Amsterdam's best kept secrets. Just down a tiny alleyway from the walking street, you'll find this whole-in-the-wall place. The beer selection is awesome and there is a ton of energy coming out of such a small bar.

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text: Cosy small bar, with 8 draught beer choices and the other alcoholic suspect's hanging from the bar, relaxed mood and a flowing dj that rides on good vibes mixes via jazz dips, old school vintages&gems. Due to it's -out of sight- location …

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text: Small bar and friendly staff.

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text: We loved this bar. Was recommended by a friend and we went back twice in the two days we were in Amsterdam. Great range of draught beers at reasonable prices (my favourite was Kwak). Friendly staff and nice atmosphere.

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text: Like many bars in Amsterdam, this place is both tiny and expensive. There's a good range of Belgian beer to choose from. Very limited seating.

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text: Have been here a fair few times and each time has been better than the last. The Belgium beer menu is something to behold, stunning Kwak on draught  and fantastic knowledgeable staff. Highly recommend

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text: Very nice place and very good beers.

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text: The bar is small but has a lot of charm to it. With a nice diversity in beer it can offer a great start or ending to your night out in Amsterdam.

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text: As a quaint local pub it is great.  Tiny with more people on the street than in the bar.  They had a dj playing all kinds of jazz, rock and pop.

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text: A good little bar in a perfect location. From the outside it is easy to judge the place as just another small and a bit nasty pub but when entering you immediately feel welcome and you notice the good selection of beers, friendly staff and good music.

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text: Great biers,  nice people. Probably the best DJ bar in Amsterdam, Thur - Sun evenings always quality vinyl DJs playing records you've probably never heard before.

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text: A very pleasant experience. Great atmosphere and great draft beers. The bar itself is a tad small, so it's better not to go there in groups.

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text: Nice range of beers, mainly Belgian and Dutch, and extremely kind bar tender - who both went out of her way to help another patron with taxis and held the patience of a saint with some particularly unruly french teenagers.

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text: Superb selection of Trappist beers. Beware some are super strength. Only a small place but well worth a visit.

Name: Caf√© Belgique
Review Text:
Cool Bartenders, specially the one with curly short hair, she is a lot of fun, but all are quite cool
Great beer, chill Djs everynight
And attracts a nice crowd

Name: Caf√© Belgique

Name: Caf√© Belgique

Name: Caf√© Belgique
